intro: Torenia spicata, commonly known as the whorled torenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Americas. It is characterized by its vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Torenia spicata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
